itemDescription: Scottish diplomat and Member of Parliament, poet and philosopher

wikipedia_page.main: Sir William James Charles Maria Drummond of Logiealmond FRS FRSE DCL (bapt. 26 September 1769 – 29 March 1828) was a Scottish diplomat and Member of Parliament, poet and philosopher. His book Academical Questions (1805) is arguably important in the development of the ideas of English Romantic poet Percy Bysshe Shelley.
